pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:0.5.eng: 2. The training rule on abusive speech

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū pesalehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhaṇḍantā pesale bhikkhū omasanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were arguing with and speaking abusively to the good monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.3.pli: jātiyāpi, nāmenapi, gottenapi, kammenapi, sippenapi, ābādhenapi, liṅgenapi, kilesenapi, āpattiyāpi; hīnenapi akkosena khuṃsenti vambhenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.3.eng: They reviled and insulted them about their caste, name, family, occupation, profession, illnesses, physical traits, defilements, and offenses, and by calling them names.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū pesalehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhaṇḍantā pesale bhikkhū omasissanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.5.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six argue with and abuse good monks?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.6.pli: jātiyāpi, nāmenapi, gottenapi, kammenapi, sippenapi, ābādhenapi, liṅgenapi, kilesenapi, āpattiyāpi; hīnenapi akkosena khuṃsessanti vambhessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.6.eng: How can they revile and insult them about these things?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.7.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, pesalehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhaṇḍantā pesale bhikkhū omasatha—jātiyāpi …pe… hīnenapi akkosena khuṃsetha vambhethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you’re doing this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, pesalehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhaṇḍantā pesale bhikkhū omasissatha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.11.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.1.15.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.1.pli: “Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, takkasilāyaṃ aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa nandivisālo nāma balībaddo ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.1.eng: “Once upon a time, monks, there was a brahmin in Takkasilā who had an ox called Nandivisāla.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.2.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, nandivisālo balībaddo taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.2.eng: On one occasion the ox said to that brahmin,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.3.pli: ‘gaccha tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, seṭṭhinā saddhiṃ sahassena abbhutaṃ karohi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.3.eng: ‘Go, brahmin, and bet a thousand coins with the wealthy merchant that your ox will pull one hundred carts tied together.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.5.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, so brāhmaṇo seṭṭhinā saddhiṃ sahassena abbhutaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.5.eng: And that brahmin did just that.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.7.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, so brāhmaṇo sakaṭasataṃ atibandhitvā nandivisālaṃ balībaddaṃ yuñjitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.7.eng: Then, after tying one hundred carts together and yoking Nandivisāla to them, he said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.9.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, nandivisālo balībaddo tattheva aṭṭhāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.10.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, so brāhmaṇo sahassena parājito pajjhāyi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.10.eng: Then that brahmin became depressed because he had lost a thousand coins.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.11.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, nandivisālo balībaddo taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.13.pli: ‘Tathā hi panāhaṃ, bho, tayā sahassena parājito’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.13.eng: ‘Because I lost one thousand coins because of you.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.14.pli: ‘Kissa pana maṃ tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, akūṭaṃ kūṭavādena pāpesi?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.14.eng: ‘But why did you disgrace me by calling me a fraud when I’m not?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.15.pli: Gaccha tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, seṭṭhinā saddhiṃ dvīhi sahassehi abbhutaṃ karohi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.15.eng: Now go, brahmin, and make the same bet with that merchant, but increase the stakes to two thousand coins.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.17.eng: Just don’t disgrace me by calling me a fraud.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.18.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, so brāhmaṇo seṭṭhinā saddhiṃ dvīhi sahassehi abbhutaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.18.eng: Once again that brahmin did just that.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.20.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, so brāhmaṇo sakaṭasataṃ atibandhitvā nandivisālaṃ balībaddaṃ yuñjitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.20.eng: Then, after tying one hundred carts together and yoking Nandivisāla to them, he said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.22.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, nandivisālo balībaddo sakaṭasataṃ atibaddhaṃ pavaṭṭesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.22.eng: And Nandivisāla pulled those one hundred carts.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.28.eng: And he was delighted with that.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.29.pli: Tadāpi me, bhikkhave, amanāpā khuṃsanā vambhanā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.29.eng: Even at that time, monks, reviling and insulting was unpleasant to me.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.30.pli: Kimaṅgaṃ pana etarahi manāpā bhavissati khuṃsanā vambhanā?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.30.eng: How then could reviling and insulting be pleasant now?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.32.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.32.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.33.1.eng: ‘If a monk speaks abusively, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.2.pli: dasahi ākārehi omasati— jātiyāpi, nāmenapi, gottenapi, kammenapi, sippenapi, ābādhenapi, liṅgenapi, kilesenapi, āpattiyāpi, akkosenapi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.2.eng: he speaks abusively in ten ways: about caste, about name, about family, about occupation, about profession, about illnesses, about physical traits, about defilements, about offenses, and by name-calling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.4.pli: dve jātiyo— hīnā ca jāti ukkaṭṭhā ca jāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.4.eng: there are two kinds of castes: low castes and high castes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.6.pli: caṇḍālajāti, venajāti, nesādajāti, rathakārajāti, pukkusajāti. Esā hīnā nāma jāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.6.eng: outcasts, bamboo workers, hunters, carriage makers, waste removers—these are called “low castes”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.8.pli: khattiyajāti, brāhmaṇajāti. Esā ukkaṭṭhā nāma jāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.8.eng: aristocrats and brahmins—these are called “high castes”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.10.pli: dve nāmāni— hīnañca nāmaṃ ukkaṭṭhañca nāmaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.10.eng: there are two kinds of names: low names and high names.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.12.pli: avakaṇṇakaṃ, javakaṇṇakaṃ, dhaniṭṭhakaṃ, saviṭṭhakaṃ, kulavaḍḍhakaṃ, tesu tesu vā pana janapadesu oññātaṃ avaññātaṃ hīḷitaṃ paribhūtaṃ acittīkataṃ, etaṃ hīnaṃ nāma nāmaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.12.eng: Avakaṇṇaka, Javakaṇṇaka, Dhaniṭṭhaka, Saviṭṭhaka, Kulavaḍḍhaka, or names, in whatever countries, that are despised, looked down upon, scorned, treated with contempt, disregarded—these are called “low names”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.14.pli: buddhappaṭisaṃyuttaṃ, dhammappaṭisaṃyuttaṃ, saṅghappaṭisaṃyuttaṃ, tesu tesu vā pana janapadesu anoññātaṃ anavaññātaṃ ahīḷitaṃ aparibhūtaṃ cittīkataṃ, etaṃ ukkaṭṭhaṃ nāma nāmaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.14.eng: those connected with the Buddha, connected with the Teaching, or connected with the Sangha, or names, in whatever countries, that are highly regarded, highly thought of, respected, valued, esteemed—these are called “high names”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.16.pli: dve gottāni— hīnañca gottaṃ ukkaṭṭhañca gottaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.16.eng: there are two kinds of families: low families and high families.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.18.pli: kosiyagottaṃ, bhāradvājagottaṃ, tesu tesu vā pana janapadesu oññātaṃ avaññātaṃ hīḷitaṃ paribhūtaṃ acittīkataṃ, etaṃ hīnaṃ nāma gottaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.18.eng: the Kosiya family, the Bhāradvāja family, or families, in whatever countries, that are despised, looked down upon, scorned, treated with contempt, disregarded—these are called “low families”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.20.pli: gotamagottaṃ, moggallānagottaṃ, kaccānagottaṃ, vāsiṭṭhagottaṃ, tesu tesu vā pana janapadesu anoññātaṃ anavaññātaṃ ahīḷitaṃ aparibhūtaṃ cittīkataṃ, etaṃ ukkaṭṭhaṃ nāma gottaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.20.eng: the Gotama family, the Moggallāna family, the Kaccāna family, the Vāsiṭṭha family, or families, in whatever countries, that are highly regarded, highly thought of, respected, valued, esteemed—these are called “high families”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.22.pli: dve kammāni— hīnañca kammaṃ ukkaṭṭhañca kammaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.22.eng: there are two kinds of occupations: low occupations and high occupations.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.24.pli: koṭṭhakakammaṃ, pupphachaḍḍakakammaṃ, tesu tesu vā pana janapadesu oññātaṃ avaññātaṃ hīḷitaṃ paribhūtaṃ acittīkataṃ, etaṃ hīnaṃ nāma kammaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.24.eng: carpentry, waste removing, or occupations, in whatever countries, that are despised, looked down upon, scorned, treated with contempt, disregarded—these are called “low occupations”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.26.pli: kasi, vaṇijjā, gorakkhā, tesu tesu vā pana janapadesu anoññātaṃ anavaññātaṃ ahīḷitaṃ aparibhūtaṃ cittīkataṃ. Etaṃ ukkaṭṭhaṃ nāma kammaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.26.eng: farming, trade, cattle keeping, or occupations, in whatever countries, that are highly regarded, highly thought of, respected, valued, esteemed—these are called “high occupations”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.28.pli: dve sippāni— hīnañca sippaṃ ukkaṭṭhañca sippaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.28.eng: there are two kinds of professions: low professions and high professions.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.30.pli: naḷakārasippaṃ, kumbhakārasippaṃ, pesakārasippaṃ, cammakārasippaṃ, nahāpitasippaṃ, tesu tesu vā pana janapadesu oññātaṃ avaññātaṃ hīḷitaṃ paribhūtaṃ acittīkataṃ. Etaṃ hīnaṃ nāma sippaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.30.eng: reed work, pottery, weaving, leather work, hairdressing, or professions, in whatever countries, that are despised, looked down upon, scorned, treated with contempt, disregarded—these are called “low professions”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.32.pli: muddā, gaṇanā, lekhā, tesu tesu vā pana janapadesu anoññātaṃ anavaññātaṃ ahīḷitaṃ aparibhūtaṃ cittīkataṃ, etaṃ ukkaṭṭhaṃ nāma sippaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.32.eng: arithmetic, accounting, writing, or professions, in whatever countries, that are highly regarded, highly thought of, respected, valued, esteemed—these are called “high professions”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.34.eng: all are low, but there is the illness of diabetes which is high.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.36.pli: dve liṅgāni— hīnañca liṅgaṃ ukkaṭṭhañca liṅgaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.36.eng: there are two kinds of physical traits: low physical traits and high physical traits.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.38.pli: atidīghaṃ, atirassaṃ, atikaṇhaṃ, accodātaṃ, etaṃ hīnaṃ nāma liṅgaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.38.eng: too tall, too short, too dark, too fair—these are called “low physical traits”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.40.pli: nātidīghaṃ, nātirassaṃ, nātikaṇhaṃ, nāccodātaṃ. Etaṃ ukkaṭṭhaṃ nāma liṅgaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.40.eng: not too tall, not too short, not too dark, not too fair—these are called “high physical traits”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.44.eng: all are low, but there is the attainment of stream-entry which is high.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.44.comm: The English translation cannot properly capture the Pali, in which the word for “offense” and “attainment” is the same, āpatti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.46.pli: dve akkosā— hīno ca akkoso ukkaṭṭho ca akkoso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.46.eng: there are two kinds of name-calling: low name-calling and high name-calling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.48.pli: oṭṭhosi, meṇḍosi, goṇosi, gadrabhosi, tiracchānagatosi, nerayikosi; natthi tuyhaṃ sugati, duggatiyeva tuyhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhāti, yakārena vā bhakārena vā, kāṭakoṭacikāya vā, eso hīno nāma akkoso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.48.eng: “You’re a camel,” “You’re a ram,” “You’re an ox,” “You’re a donkey,” “You’re an animal,” “You’re bound for hell,” “You’re not going to a good destination,” “You can only expect a bad destination,” or adding disparaging endings to someone’s name, or calling someone words for the male or female genitals—this is called “low name-calling”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.50.pli: paṇḍitosi, byattosi, medhāvīsi, bahussutosi, dhammakathikosi, natthi tuyhaṃ duggati, sugatiyeva tuyhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhāti, eso ukkaṭṭho nāma akkoso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.1.50.eng: “You’re wise,” “You’re competent,” “You’re intelligent,” “You’re learned,” “You’re an expounder of the Teaching,” “You’re not going to a bad destination,” “You can only expect a good destination”—this is called “high name-calling”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo hīnena hīnaṃ vadeti, caṇḍālaṃ venaṃ nesādaṃ rathakāraṃ pukkusaṃ— “caṇḍālosi, venosi, nesādosi, rathakārosi, pukkusosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.1.eng: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to revile, wishing to insult, wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, says what is low to one who is low—an outcast, a bamboo worker, a hunter, a carriage maker, a waste remover—saying, “You’re an outcast,” “You’re a bamboo worker,” “You’re a hunter,” “You’re a carriage maker,” “You’re a waste remover,” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo hīnena ukkaṭṭhaṃ vadeti, khattiyaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ— “caṇḍālosi, venosi, nesādosi, rathakārosi, pukkusosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.2.eng: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to revile, wishing to insult, wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, says what is low to one who is high—an aristocrat, a brahmin—saying, “You’re an outcast,” “You’re a bamboo worker,” “You’re a hunter,” “You’re a carriage maker,” “You’re a waste remover,” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo ukkaṭṭhena hīnaṃ vadeti, caṇḍālaṃ venaṃ nesādaṃ rathakāraṃ pukkusaṃ— “khattiyosi, brāhmaṇosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.3.eng: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to revile, wishing to insult, wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, says what is high to one who is low—an outcast, a bamboo worker, a hunter, a carriage maker, a waste remover—saying, “You’re an aristocrat,” “You’re a brahmin,” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.4.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo ukkaṭṭhena ukkaṭṭhaṃ vadeti, khattiyaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ— “khattiyosi, brāhmaṇosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.4.eng: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to revile, wishing to insult, wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, says what is high to one who is high—an aristocrat, a brahmin—saying, “You’re an aristocrat,” “You’re a brahmin,” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.5.1.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo hīnena hīnaṃ vadeti, avakaṇṇakaṃ javakaṇṇakaṃ dhaniṭṭhakaṃ saviṭṭhakaṃ kulavaḍḍhakaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.5.1.eng: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to revile, wishing to insult, wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, says what is low to one who is low—an Avakaṇṇaka, a Javakaṇṇaka, a Dhaniṭṭhaka, a Saviṭṭhaka, a Kulavaḍḍhaka—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.6.pli: “avakaṇṇakosi, javakaṇṇakosi, dhaniṭṭhakosi, saviṭṭhakosi, kulavaḍḍhakosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.6.eng: saying, “You’re an Avakaṇṇaka,” “You’re a Javakaṇṇaka,” “You’re a Dhaniṭṭhaka,” “You’re a Saviṭṭhaka,” “You’re a Kulavaḍḍhaka,” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.7.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo hīnena ukkaṭṭhaṃ vadeti, buddharakkhitaṃ dhammarakkhitaṃ saṅgharakkhitaṃ— “avakaṇṇakosi, javakaṇṇakosi, dhaniṭṭhakosi, saviṭṭhakosi, kulavaḍḍhakosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.7.eng: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to revile, wishing to insult, wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, says what is low to one who is high—a Buddharakkhita, a Dhammarakkhita, a Sangharakkhita—saying, “You’re an Avakaṇṇaka,” “You’re a Javakaṇṇaka,” “You’re a Dhaniṭṭhaka,” “You’re a Saviṭṭhaka,” “You’re a Kulavaḍḍhaka,” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.35.1.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo hīnena hīnaṃ vadeti, pārājikaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ thullaccayaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ pācittiyaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ dukkaṭaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ— “pārājikaṃ ajjhāpannosi, saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpannosi, thullaccayaṃ ajjhāpannosi, pācittiyaṃ ajjhāpannosi, pāṭidesanīyaṃ ajjhāpannosi, dukkaṭaṃ ajjhāpannosi, dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpannosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.35.1.eng: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to revile, wishing to insult, wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, says what is low to one who is low—one who has committed an offense entailing expulsion, one who has committed an offense entailing suspension, one who has committed a serious offense, one who has committed an offense entailing confession, one who has committed an offense entailing acknowledgment, one who has committed an offense of wrong conduct, one who has committed an offense of wrong speech—saying, “You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion,” “You’ve committed an offense entailing suspension,” “You’ve committed a serious offense,” “You’ve committed an offense entailing confession,” “You’ve committed an offense entailing acknowledgment,” “You’ve committed an offense of wrong conduct,” “You’ve committed an offense of wrong speech,” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.36.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo hīnena ukkaṭṭhaṃ vadeti, sotāpannaṃ— “pārājikaṃ ajjhāpannosi …pe… dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpannosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.36.eng: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to revile, wishing to insult, wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, says what is low to one who is high—a stream-enterer—saying, “You’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion,” “You’ve committed an offense entailing suspension,” “You’ve committed a serious offense,” “You’ve committed an offense entailing confession,” “You’ve committed an offense entailing acknowledgment,” “You’ve committed an offense of wrong conduct,” “You’ve committed an offense of wrong speech,” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.37.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo ukkaṭṭhena hīnaṃ vadeti, pārājikaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ …pe… dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ— “sotāpannosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.37.eng: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to revile, wishing to insult, wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, says what is high to one who is low—one who has committed an offense entailing expulsion, one who has committed an offense entailing suspension, one who has committed a serious offense, one who has committed an offense entailing confession, one who has committed an offense entailing acknowledgment, one who has committed an offense of wrong conduct, one who has committed an offense of wrong speech—saying, “You’re a stream-enterer,” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.38.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo ukkaṭṭhena ukkaṭṭhaṃ vadeti, sotāpannaṃ— “sotāpannosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.38.eng: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to revile, wishing to insult, wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, says what is high to one who is high—a stream-enterer—saying, “You’re a stream-enterer,” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.39.1.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo hīnena hīnaṃ vadeti, oṭṭhaṃ meṇḍaṃ goṇaṃ gadrabhaṃ tiracchānagataṃ nerayikaṃ— “oṭṭhosi, meṇḍosi, goṇosi, gadrabhosi, tiracchānagatosi, nerayikosi, natthi tuyhaṃ sugati, duggati yeva tuyhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.39.1.eng: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to revile, wishing to insult, wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, says what is low to one who is low—a camel, a ram, an ox, a donkey, an animal, one bound for hell—saying, “You’re a camel,” “You’re a ram,” “You’re an ox,” “You’re a donkey,” “You’re an animal,” “You’re bound for hell,” “You’re not going to a good destination,” “You can only expect a bad destination,” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.2.40.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo hīnena ukkaṭṭhaṃ vadeti, paṇḍitaṃ byattaṃ medhāviṃ bahussutaṃ dhammakathikaṃ— “oṭṭhosi, meṇḍosi, goṇosi, gadrabhosi, tiracchānagatosi, nerayikosi, natthi tuyhaṃ sugati, duggatiyeva tuyhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.3.1.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ khuṃsetukāmo vambhetukāmo maṅkukattukāmo evaṃ vadeti, “santi idhekacce caṇḍālā venā nesādā rathakārā pukkusā”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya dukkaṭassa.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.7.0.eng: Not intending to abuse, direct speech

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.7.1.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ na khuṃsetukāmo na vambhetukāmo na maṅkukattukāmo, davakamyatā hīnena hīnaṃ vadeti, caṇḍālaṃ venaṃ nesādaṃ rathakāraṃ pukkusaṃ— “caṇḍālosi, venosi, nesādosi, rathakārosi, pukkusosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya dubbhāsitassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.7.1.eng: If one who is fully ordained, not wishing to revile, not wishing to insult, not wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, but wanting to have fun, says what is low to one who is low—an outcast, a bamboo worker, a hunter, a carriage maker, a waste remover—saying, “You’re an outcast,” “You’re a bamboo worker,” “You’re a hunter,” “You’re a carriage maker,” “You’re a waste remover,” then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.7.2.pli: Upasampanno upasampannaṃ na khuṃsetukāmo na vambhetukāmo na maṅkukattukāmo, davakamyatā hīnena ukkaṭṭhaṃ vadeti, khattiyaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ— “caṇḍālosi, venosi, nesādosi, rathakārosi, pukkusosī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti vācāya, vācāya dubbhāsitassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.7.2.eng: If one who is fully ordained, not wishing to revile, not wishing to insult, not wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, but wanting to have fun, says what is low to one who is high—an aristocrat, a brahmin—saying, “You’re an outcast,” “You’re a bamboo worker,” “You’re a hunter,” “You’re a carriage maker,” “You’re a waste remover,” then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:2.7.3.eng: If one who is fully ordained, not wishing to revile, not wishing to insult, not wishing to humiliate another who is fully ordained, but wanting to have fun, says what is high to one who is low—an outcast, a bamboo worker, a hunter, a carriage maker, a waste remover—saying, “You’re an aristocrat,” “You’re a brahmin,” then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong speech.
